alert.note: Alert for Ottawa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 18 at 2:02AM CDT until June 18 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM CDT FOR OTTAWA COUNTY... At 202 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Treece to 5 miles southeast of Wyandotte, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Miami... Commerce... Fairland... Quapaw... Wyandotte... Picher... Ottawa... Peoria... Cardin... Twin Bridges State Park... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 303 and 324. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
